page.title: 08HOUSES IN ASPULL
page.content: The people of the area are a mixture of the old generations of{Aspullites} and newcomers to the new housing developments. Very few foreigners have settled in the area. The locals speak with a broad Lancashire{dialect}and are usually good neighbours, but are seriously being affected by the high rate of unemployment in the 1980's. The property in the village varies from old miners cottages to terraced houses, council estates and a variety of private dwellings, thus catering for many classes of people. Many of the older properties have been attractively renovated. {Aspull}is now a dormitory village for the people who work in Wigan, Bolton and the surrounding areas, also providing access to the{M61}via Bolton road for routes to the north and east.
